title: Resume Builder with AI-Style Coaching

requirements.text: Implement backend data models and persistence for resumes, including CRUD operations scoped to the callerâ€™s Principal (so each user only accesses their own resumes).

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to create, read (list + detail), update, and delete a resume.
Resumes are stored in canister stable state and survive canister upgrades (add migration.mo only if required by the template/state).
Access control ensures a caller can only read/write/delete resumes they own (by Principal).

requirements.text: Create a resume editor UI that lets users build a resume using structured sections (at minimum: Basics/Contact, Summary, Work Experience, Education, Skills) with add/edit/reorder capabilities for repeating items (e.g., multiple jobs).

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Users can create a new resume, edit fields across the required sections, and save changes.
Work Experience and Education support multiple entries and reordering.
UI validates basic required fields (e.g., name) and prevents saving empty required fields.

requirements.text: Add a live resume preview view that renders the resume in a clean, print-friendly layout and supports exporting via the browser print dialog (user can save as PDF).

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Preview updates immediately when the user edits the resume.
Preview layout is print-friendly (reasonable margins, no app chrome in print where practical).
An "Export" action opens the browser print dialog for saving as PDF.

requirements.text: Implement an AI-style coaching feature that analyzes the current resume content using deterministic heuristics (no external AI services) and returns actionable suggestions categorized by section (e.g., impact, clarity, keywords, formatting consistency).

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: User can run coaching on a selected resume and see a list of suggestions grouped by section/category.

Suggestions are generated from deterministic rules (e.g., detect missing metrics in experience bullets, overly long summary, missing dates, inconsistent capitalization/punctuation, weak verbs, skill list too short/too long).
Coaching results are reproducible for the same input and do not call any third-party LLM or API.

requirements.text: Persist coaching runs/results per resume so users can view the latest coaching output after refreshing the app (store at least the latest run timestamp and suggestions).

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores coaching results associated with a resume and user principal.
Frontend shows the most recent coaching results when revisiting a resume.
User can re-run coaching to overwrite/append to previous results (choose one approach and keep it consistent).

requirements.text: Add an application shell with navigation for: Resume List, Resume Editor/Preview, and Coaching, using React Query for all canister reads/writes and consistent loading/error states.

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Resume List shows all user resumes and allows opening, duplicating, and deleting a resume.
All data operations use React Query with clear loading indicators and error messages.
Navigation works without broken routes/pages and preserves selected resume context where appropriate.

requirements.text: Define and apply a cohesive visual theme for the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) with a professional editorial look (avoid blue/purple as primary colors) and ensure it is used consistently across all pages.

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistently applied across list, editor, preview, and coaching views.
Primary palette is not blue/purple; overall look is professional and readable.
Forms and preview have strong typographic hierarchy and accessible contrast.

requirements.text: Add generated static image assets (logo + optional hero/empty-state illustration) to the frontend and display them in the app shell/landing/empty states.

quotes: Create a  resume builder and coaching ai app

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
Logo is shown in the app header/shell.
Illustration is used in an appropriate empty state (e.g., no resumes yet) without impacting core functionality.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo (add backend/migration.mo only if needed for state upgrades).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not use external AI/LLM services or third-party auth providers; only local deterministic coaching logic is allowed.
nonGoals: Integrations with external job boards/ATS systems.
Third-party LLM integration or API-based AI coaching.

required: Minimalist typographic logo mark, black/charcoal on transparent background (resume-coach-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Simple editorial-style illustration of a desk with paper and checklist, warm neutral palette (empty-state-illustration.dim_1200x800.png)
